back.text:
Alphabet, Google's parent company, stands as one of the world's foremost AI innovators with deep research roots dating back to the early days of modern machine learning. The company's AI journey began with foundational research at Google Brain and DeepMind, which has since evolved into a comprehensive AI strategy spanning consumer products, cloud services, and fundamental research breakthroughs.

Alphabet's AI portfolio is centered around the Gemini family of multimodal foundation models and the more accessible Gemma series designed for wider deployment. Key offerings include:

• Gemini 2.5: The company's most advanced multimodal AI system, capable of sophisticated reasoning across text, code, audio, and visual inputs
• Gemma: An open series of lightweight models designed for responsible deployment and fine-tuning across diverse applications

Through Google Cloud's Vertex AI platform, Alphabet democratizes access to these powerful models while supporting enterprise customization needs. Meanwhile, the company continues to integrate AI capabilities across its product ecosystem, from Google Search and Gmail to Android and YouTube. Alphabet's commitment to responsible AI development is reflected in its multi-layered approach to safety, with sophisticated systems for identifying harmful outputs and mitigating potential risks across deployment scenarios.
